bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Henry Halleck (1815-1872) was born in Utica, New York, and attended West Point. He remained in the army until 1854, when he resigned to be a lawyer; he re-entered the army in 1861 as major-general. He became General-in-Chief of the Union Armies in 1862, and following the war was transferred to the Division of the Pacific and later to the Division of the South in Louisville, Kentucky.
